result.execSummary:
The defendant Matthew D. Olday was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Matthew D. Olday is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Matthew D. Olday was found guilty of Manufacture/Deliver Heroin (<3g) [Modifiers: Second and Subsequent Offense, PTAC, as a Party to a Crime, Possession with Intent to Deliver/Distribute a Controlled Substance On or Near a Youth Center], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(d)1.
  • Matthew D. Olday was found guilty of Manufacture/Deliver Heroin (<3g) [Modifiers: Second and Subsequent Offense, PTAC, as a Party to a Crime, Possession with Intent to Deliver/Distribute a Controlled Substance On or Near a Youth Center], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(d)1.
  • Matthew D. Olday was found guilty of Manufacture/Deliver Heroin (<3g) [Modifiers: Second and Subsequent Offense, PTAC, as a Party to a Crime, Possession with Intent to Deliver/Distribute a Controlled Substance On or Near a Youth Center], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(d)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: Obtain/maintain full time employment/school per agent

Provide DNA sample.  Undergo any counseling/treatment per agent to include Criminal Thinking.  Not to possess controlled substances w/o valid prescription and must notify agent w/in 48 hours if one is received.  Not to go to taverns/bars or business where primary purpose of business is sale of alcohol or drug paraphernalia. Not associate w/anyone under the influence or drugs/alcohol.   Absolute Sobriety from alcohol and controlled substances.  Random UAs.

If probation/extended supervision revoked or discharges with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Matthew D. Olday in court with attorney Preston James Smead.  Defendant Matthew D. Olday in custody.  John A. Newton appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court states cases and parties state appearances.  State states recommendations/agreement.  Atty Smead agrees and guilty pleas entered to counts 1-3 in 14CF117 and count 1 in 14CF137.  DE agrees.  Court questions DE on pleas/accepts/finds guilty.  Court questions DE on right to PSI.  DE waives right to PSI.  Court accepts waiver of PSI.  State makes statement.  Atty Smead makes statement.  DE makes brief statement.  Court admonishes DE and sentences.  Court advises DE of voting rights, appeal rights and felony firearm warnings.  Court now addresses 14CX3 as to this matter.  State files order for default judgment in re: to possession of the motor vehicle seized in this matter.  State notes they have received no response from the DE in this matter so they are requesting default judgment.  Court questions service of summons and complaint upon DE.  State says officer was going to serve documents upon the DE on the date this was filed in April 2014.  Atty Smead says he isn't ready on that and this issue is outside his scope as to representation on this matter.  DE states he's not agreeing to anything today.  State says they'll take care of that.  Court is adjourned.

14CF117
Cts 1, 2 and 3:  Guilty
7 years prison (3 years initial confinement + 4 years extended supervision) concurrent to each other but consecutive to any other sentence to commence FORTHWITH
33 days sentence credit excluding today's date
DE is eligible for ERP/CIP/SAP
Conditions of extended supervision:
Costs of $268.00 and surcharges of $250.00 x 3 to be paid per agent
DNA sample to be provided
AODA/Treatment per agent
Absolute sobriety from alcohol and controlled substances at all times unless he has a valid prescription
Random Urinalysis
Not to go to bars/taverns/liquor stores or businesses that sell drug paraphernalia
Not to associate w/anyone under the influence of drugs/alcohol
Attend Criminal Thinking classes
Obtain/maintain full-time employment/education per agent
Any other conditions per agent
Ct 4, 5 and 6:  Dismissed/read-in

14CF137
Ct 1:  Guilty
Probation for 4 years consecutive to extended supervision in 14CF117
Conditions of probation are the same as the conditions of extended supervision in 14CF117
Cts 2-6:  Dismissed/read-in
Jury trial on November 5, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Final pre-trial on October 27, 2014 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant Matthew D. Olday in court with attorney Preston James Smead.  Defendant Matthew D. Olday in custody.  Sue Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Matters are not resolved.  Request trial.  Preliminary waiver has already taken place.  New discovery has been received as well.    Stands Mute, Court enters Not Guilty Plea, set for trial Br. 3.  Bond continues.

Pre-trial conference on August 22, 2014 at 10:30 am.
Return date on September 5, 2014 at 01:00 pm.

Atty Smead agrees to waive time limits for prelim.  DE agrees.  Court sets for PTC and RD.  Bond conitnued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 20, 2014 at 09:00 am.  Return date scheduled for July 11, 2014 at 01:00 pm.
records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt: Preliminary hearing on May 9, 2014 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Matthew D. Olday in court, in custody.  John Newton appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State states case and appearances.  Court questions DE re: counsel.  DE states he couldn't afford private counsel and was told to apply for court-appointed counsel.  Court questions DE re: possible time limit waiver for prelim so DE can get counsel.  DE is in agreement.  Court accepts time limit waiver.  Matter reset for prelim.  Time limits waived.  Court advises DE he needs to apply for counsel at the PD's office first and then if he doesn't qualify he can ask the Court for court-appointed counsel.  Bond continued.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 9, 2014 at 09:30 am.
records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt: Preliminary hearing on April 11, 2014 at 09:45 am.

Defendant Matthew D. Olday appeared by video means with Attorney Steinman. Prosecuting Atty Sue Mueller appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Defendant has not yet applied.  State request $10,000 cash bond w/ conditions.  Defendant waives reading of complaint.  Advised rights to an attorney.  Requests Preliminary hearing; Time limits not waived. $10,000.00 CASH  bond set.  Special bond conditions as follows: No contact with R.C., J.O, J.C. & T.H., also no contact with 426 Monroe Street, Sauk City WI residence.  No possession of any controlled substances unless used in accordance with a Rx.  May return to premises to pick up personal property w/ law enforcement, one time.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 11, 2014 at 09:45 am.
